channel.title: Which is safer, Linux or Android?
channel.description: I'm not sure which is more secure, Linux or Android. Linux here is QubesOS (Whonix also works with it), and Android is GrapheneOS. Briefly, QubesOS uses Xen virtualization technology to run each app separately. GrapheneOS has hardened memory allocator etc. One question here is which is safer? The more you look it up, the less you know. So please tell me.

item.title: Which is safer, Linux or Android?
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.source: Which is safer, Linux or Android?

item.title: Which is safer, Linux or Android?

item.description:
Which is safer, Linux or Android? is a general security question and best redirected to a place dedicated to general computer security.

See:
https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Support

Hence, closing here.

Read full topic

item.title: Which is safer, Linux or Android?
item.dc:creator: HulaHoop
item.description:
I was writing a lengthy reply then I remembered, “We have a page for that!” like most topics

Whonix – 12 Jul 20

Kicksecure ™: A Security-hardened, Non-anonymous Linux Distribution

Kicksecure ™ is a security-hardened Debian based Linux distribution that provides better protection from malware.

Read full topic

item.description:
I’m not sure which is more secure, Linux or Android. Linux here is QubesOS (Whonix also works with it), and Android is GrapheneOS. Briefly, QubesOS uses Xen virtualization technology to run each app separately. GrapheneOS has hardened memory allocator etc. One question here is which is safer? The more you look it up, the less you know. So please tell me.
